definitions.definition: used to emphasize something that is real or exists in fact

examples.text: James looks younger than his wife but **in actual fact** *(= really)* he is five years older.
The actual cost was higher than we expected.
The actual number of unemployed is more than 15 million.
A variety of factors could cause our actual results to differ from the expected results.
The story of the film is based on actual events and people.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the most important part of something

examples.text: The rehearsal was fabulous, the actual performance even better.
The wedding preparations take weeks but the actual ceremony takes less than an hour.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French actuel ‘active, practical’, from late Latin actualis, from actus ‘event, thing done’, act- ‘done’, from the verb agere, reinforced by the French noun acte.
